TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PropertyValues extends System.Object

summary.para: A collection of all property values for an entity.
Objects of this type can be obtained from , , , or . Once obtained, the objects are usually used in various combinations to resolve optimitisic concurrency exceptions signalled by the throwing of a .

Docs.summary: Creates a clone of the values in this object. Changes made to the new object will not be reflected in this object and vice versa.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void SetValues (Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ChangeTracking.PropertyValues propertyValues);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetValues(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ChangeTracking.PropertyValues propertyValues) cil managed

Docs.param: The object from which values should be coiped.

summary.para: Sets the values of this object by reading values from another object.
The other object must be based on the same type as this object, or a type derived from the type for this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetValues (System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,object> values);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetValues(class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, object> values) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub SetValues (values As IDictionary(Of String, Object))

Docs.param: The dictionary to read values from.

summary.para: Sets the values of this object by copying values from the given dictionary.
The keys of the dictionary must match property names. Any key in the dictionary that does not match the name of a property in the entity type will be ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void SetValues (object obj);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetValues(object obj) cil managed
Public MustOverride Sub SetValues (obj As Object)

Docs.param: The object to read values from.

summary.para: Sets the values of this object by copying values from the given object.

The given object can be of any type. Any property on the object with a name that matches a property name in the entity type and can be read will be copied. Other properties will be ignored. This allows, for example, copying of properties from simple Data Transfer Objects (DTOs).

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract object ToObject ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object ToObject() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function ToObject () As Object

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the entity type and sets all its properties using the values from this object.
Docs.returns: The values of this object copied into a new entity instance.
